original: Edler, Per Jönsson, fil. dr, fd. lektor, Göteborg, f. 13/6/78 i S. Mellby, Krist. 1. G. 20 m. Linnea Grimberg. Barn: Britta f. 22, Folke 23, Per Tore 30. — Stud:ex. i Ystad 97, fil. kand. i Lund 00, fil. lic. 08, fil. dr 16, prov-år v. norra real i Sthilm 02-03. Res. t. Danm., Norge, Tyskl., EngL, Frankr., Schweiz o. Ital. Lär. i Eslöv 01-02, e. lär. i Karlskrona 03-06, v. Mialmö realsk. 06-07, v. Malmö h. a. 1. 07-08, adj. v. Örebro h. a. 1. 07, dito v. nya elem. i Sthlm 12, lektor i mode rsm. o. hist. v. Gbgs fodksk :’S’em. 18- 43, pens. 43. Skr.: Om börd o. befordran (grad:avh.), Utveckl :linjer i d. mod. stats- o. samh :livets hist., Eng. statsmän, div. skolböcker, upps. o. rec. i div. tidskr. RNO.
translated: Edler, Per Jönsson, PhD, former lecturer, Gothenburg, born June 13, 1878 in Södra Mellby. Married to Linnea Grimberg in 1920 with whom he had three children: Britta (born 1922), Folke (born 1923), and Per Tore (born 1930). Edler completed his high school studies in Ystad in 1897, obtained a Bachelor's degree from Lund University in 1900, a Master's degree in 1908, and a PhD in 1916. He completed a probationary year at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1902-1903, and then traveled to Denmark, Norway, Germany, England, France, Switzerland, and Italy. Edler worked as a teacher in Eslöv from 1901 to 1902, then in Karlskrona from 1903 to 1906, and finally taught at Malmö Real School from 1906 to 1907 and then at Malmö High School from 1907 to 1908. He was an adjunct teacher at Örebro High School in 1907, and also worked at the new elementary school in Stockholm in 1912. From 1918 to 1943, he worked as a lecturer in modern national economic history at Gothenburg people's high school, and was retired from 1943. Edler has written several articles and reviews in various magazines, and has authored several school textbooks and books including "Om börd och befordran" (On birth and promotion), "Utveckling: linjer i den moderna stats- och samhällslivets historia" (Development: lines in the modern history of national and social life), and "Engelska statsmän" (English statesmen). Edler was awarded the Order of the North Star.

structured.name: Per Jönsson Edler
jobTitle: Lecturer in modern national economic history
structured.description: Per Jönsson Edler was a Swedish lecturer and expert in modern national economic history. He was born on June 13, 1878 in Södra Mellby, Sweden. Edler completed his high school studies in Ystad in 1897, obtained a Bachelor's degree from Lund University in 1900, a Master's degree in 1908, and a PhD in 1916. He completed a probationary year at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1902-1903, and then traveled to Denmark, Norway, Germany, England, France, Switzerland, and Italy. He worked as a teacher in Eslöv from 1901 to 1902, then in Karlskrona from 1903 to 1906, and finally taught at Malmö Real School from 1906 to 1907 and then at Malmö High School from 1907 to 1908. From 1918 to 1943, he worked as a lecturer in modern national economic history at Gothenburg people's high school, and was retired from 1943. Edler has written several articles and reviews in various magazines, and has authored several school textbooks and books including 'Om börd och befordran' (On birth and promotion), 'Utveckling: linjer i den moderna stats- och samhällslivets historia' (Development: lines in the modern history of national and social life), and 'Engelska statsmän' (English statesmen). Edler was awarded the Order of the North Star.
